Great! Based on your message, you are looking for resources and activities on the topic of "Derivation" in the subject of Calculus, for a 12th-grade level, with a lesson duration of 12 units. Here are some recommendations:

Resources:
1. Textbook: Check your school's Calculus textbook for a dedicated chapter on Derivation. It will provide comprehensive explanations and examples.
2. Online Tutorials: There are various online platforms, such as Khan Academy and Coursera, that offer free video tutorials on Derivation in Calculus. You can search for "Derivation Calculus tutorial" on Google to find relevant resources.

Activities:
1. Derivative Practice Problems: Provide your students with a set of derivative practice problems. They can practice finding derivatives using different rules and techniques. You can create your own worksheet or find printable worksheets online using the query "Derivative practice problems worksheet" on Google.
2. Real-World Applications: Engage students by showing them real-world applications of derivatives, such as analyzing the speed and acceleration of moving objects or optimization problems. You can search for "Real-world applications of derivatives in Calculus" on Google to find specific examples and activities.

Remember to adapt the resources and activities to the specific needs and learning objectives of your students. I hope these recommendations are helpful. If you have any more specific questions or need further assistance, feel free to ask!
